titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Lady Agnes Anne Adams Papers LSC.1361
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lilace Hatayama, May 1986; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

p.subject: Arts and Humanities --Literature--Fiction
Arts and Humanities--Journalism
Social Sciences--Area and Interdisciplinary Studies --Women's Studies

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-02 10:57:44 -0700.

did.abstract: Lady Adams (1869-1942) was born Agnes Anne Cook in Scotland. She wrote popular articles for newspapers and magazines. The collection consists of manuscripts, correspondence, photographs, and ephemera related to Lady Adams's life and writings.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lady Agnes Anne Adams Papers (Collection 1361). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lady Adams was born Agnes Anne Cook in Scotland in 1869; married John Adams in Glasgow, 1893; his academic career took him to the University of London, University of California at Berkeley, and UCLA and also on travels to New Zealand, Australia, and South Africa; Lady Adams wrote popular articles for newspapers and magazines; widowed, 1934; died in Los Angeles, 1942; posthumous selection and bibliography of writings published as Tea-Time (1942).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of manuscripts, correspondence, photographs, and ephemera related to the life and writings of Lady Adams. Includes material concerning her friend, Maven Thorpe.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Manuscripts (Boxes 1-2).
Notes, fragments, clippings, speeches, photographs, ephemera (Box 3).
Correspondence (Box 4).
Posters and watercolor of New Zealand (Box 5).

p.emph: Note: Titles of manuscripts are in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.p: With a note by Majl Ewing regarding Lady Adams's intention to collect children's poems and set them to music.

p.emph: Beginning, I regret that I am not going to be able to talk to you in French today...
Beginning, People had always said it would happen --...
Beginning, You remember the story in 'A Window in Thrums,'...
Beginning, I am condemned to death...

did.unittitle: Clippings regarding the death of Lady Adams and related material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes articles regarding a memorial volume, Tea-Time, composed of Lady Adams's articles compiled by her friends, and a memorial booklet, Lady Adams by W. Bertrand Stevens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
